lines.content: * The {@code Deadline} class represents a task that has a specific deadline by which it needs to be completed.
* It extends the {@code Task} class and is marked with a "D" to indicate that it is a Deadline task.
/** The deadline by which the task should be completed. */

* @param by The deadline by which the task should be completed.

* The {@code Event} class represents a task that spans a specific period of time, starting and ending at particular dates/times.
* It extends the {@code Task} class and is marked with an "E" to indicate that it is an Event task.

* Enum representing different types of commands.
* The {@code Gutti} class represents a simple chatbot that can add tasks, list them,
* mark them as done, unmark them, and exit on command.
* The chatbot greets the user, processes commands to add and list tasks,
* and provides a farewell message before exiting when the user types the "bye" command.
private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* This method prints a welcome message and prompts the user to enter commands.
System.out.println("What can I do for you? Meow");
* This method prints a goodbye message and indicates that the chatbot is closing.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon! Meow");
* Handles user input after the user initializes the chatbot.
* This method continuously reads user input from the console.
* It supports adding tasks (todo, deadline, event), listing tasks,
* marking/unmarking tasks as done, and exiting the program with the "bye" command.
input = scanner.nextLine().trim(); // Trim input to handle extra spaces
generateError(new GuttiException("Meow me dumb dumb me no understand me no thoughts head empty."));

* The {@code GuttiException} class represents a custom exception used in the {@code Gutti} chatbot.
* This exception is thrown to indicate errors specific to the chatbot's operations,
* such as incorrect command formats or invalid task operations.
* Constructs a new {@code GuttiException} with the specified detail message.
* The detail message is saved for later retrieval by the {@link #getMessage()} method.
* @param message The detail message to be saved for this exception.
* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* The task can be marked as done or not done.
* The completion status of the task. True if the task is done, false otherwise. is false by default.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not marked as done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" if the task is done, a space otherwise.
* @return The status icon of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
